title: My Plagiarism
summary:
Key ideas
- Plagiarism can be classified as careless, slightly cautious, more cautious, and very cautious.
- The deeper the understanding of the underlying concept, the more the text departs from plagiarism.
- Writers blend the things they read into their writing, resulting in a "slurry," and that's quite normal.

Key learnings
- Blending distinct experiences of literature is essential to create a unique style of writing, but that doesn't necessarily mean inserting someone else's words without perfect attribution.
- It is possible to use someone else's work as inspiration in your writing, but you must transform it into your words.
 
Key questions
- What are the implications of unintentional plagiarism?
- How can one transform others' work into their words and make it unique?
- What are some excellent methods to keep from unconsciously plagiarizing?
